result.execSummary:
The defendant David Mortner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: with Huber privileges.   IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess Huber funds be applied toward any and all outstanding restitution, fines/costs while serving his/her mandatory jail sentence.

miscConds.notes:
Pay $500.00 fine plus costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
---------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
---------------------------

No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
--------------------------

Defendant may reside in Colorado as long as the Department of Corrections authorizes.
The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.
---------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
---------------------------

timeConds.notes: WITHOUT work release privileges to commence forthwith.
